item.title: Free Flu Shot Clinic to be Held for Students October 30
item.description: The Student Health Center will be holding a free flu shot clinic on Wednesday, October 30 from 9:00 AM until 3:30 PM at the East Campus Athletic Village (ECAV).
item.author: Students

item.title: RPIrates Monthly Meeting: “Linux Shell Expansion for R Dummies”
item.description: Stepping into the Land of Linux is unavoidable for serious data analysts, and a mastery of the command line is a definite superpower for R users. Shell expansion enables Linux users to generate complex commands and manipulate data efficiently. In this discussion we’ll use the echo command explore various types of expansions.
item.author: Students

item.title: The Title IX Office Issues a Call for Student Participation in their Sexual Misconduct Awareness and Prevention Survey
item.description: Your Voice Matters – please check your RPI email for an invitation to respond to the Sexual Misconduct Awareness and Prevention Survey. Your participation in this confidential survey will assist us in our ability to protect and support students at RPI. All matriculated students on the Troy campus, who are over age 18, are encouraged to participate. We want to hear from you. The survey link is found in your RPI email.
item.author: Students

item.title: Be a Part of RPI’s Premier Cybersecurity Team!
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 30, 2024 6:00 PM - 7:00 PM - The #1 collegiate cybersecurity CTF team in the country is looking for new players, so if you’d like to be part of the Rensselaer Cybersecurity Collaboratory, just stop by Sage 3101 every Wednesday evening through the end of the semester! No experience necessary, just a willingness to learn and try new things. Contact Dr. Brian Callahan if you have questions.

item.title: RPI and Birla Institute of Technology and Science, Pilani, to Collaborate on STEM Education, Research
item.description: Rensselaer has signed a letter of intent with Birla Institute of Technology and Science, Pilani (BITS Pilani), one of India’s leading technological universities, to establish academic cooperation and offer joint educational programs and research initiatives. The development marks a significant step towards enhancing worldwide academic engagement between two premier institutions in the fields of engineering, science, and technology.
item.author: Community

item.title: Faculty Seeking Feedback with Home Energy Efficiency Survey
item.description: Join a team of Rensselaer faculty who are helping to shape the future of eco-friendly home energy efficiency by developing siding material made from hemp that can boost home comfort and energy efficiency! Campus community members are invited to take a quick survey to provide feedback to help the team tailor this groundbreaking product.

item.title: “Allyship in Action” Panel Event to be Held October 30
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 30, 2024 3:00 PM - 4:00 PM - All Rensselaer students, staff, faculty, and alumni are invited to take part in this virtual Webex event to hear from a panel of lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and queer (LGBTQ+) individuals from the Rensselaer community as they discuss the meaning and importance of allyship, and how to help create safe and supportive communities for LGBTQ+ individuals.

item.title: AI/ML Research Reading Group Meetings to Begin October 2
item.description: If you’re interested in decoding complex AI/ML research, this group’s goal is to read and discuss diverse research papers in the interdisciplinary areas of AI/ML/NLP, IS, and HCI. Whether you’re a novice or a seasoned researcher, all RPI members are welcome to attend the group’s first meeting from 11AM to noon on October 2 in Pittsburgh 4114 to contribute to the discussions; the group will then meet bi-weekly. Contact Lydia Manikonda if you have questions!
item.author: Community

item.title: CEE Seminar Series Continues October 30
item.description:
Date: Wednesday, October 30, 2024 1:00 PM - 2:00 PM - In a talk titled “Innovative Data-Driven Solutions for Traffic Operations,” Dr. Yao-jan Wu, a Professor at the University of Arizona, will discuss how one of the primary strategies of transportation agencies for maintaining the safety, mobility, and efficiency of a transportation system is to use Intelligent Transportation System (ITS) technologies and innovative data-driven strategies.
